meanings.definition: Of or relating to the navel or umbilicus.
meanings.sent1: The umbonic area is where the belly button is located.
meanings.sent2: Her dress had an umbonic design that highlighted her waist.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted an umbonic flower that seemed to bloom from the center of the canvas.
meanings.sent4: The clock's hands moved in an umbonic motion, revolving around the center.
meanings.sent5: The spider created an umbonic web, starting from the middle and expanding outward.

meanings.definition: Resembling or shaped like an umbilicus.
meanings.sent1: The umbonic sculpture looked like a giant belly button.
meanings.sent2: The cake had an umbonic decoration that resembled a twisted umbilical cord.
meanings.sent3: The clouds formed an umbonic shape in the sky, resembling a belly button.
meanings.sent4: The tree's branches grew in an umbonic pattern, curving inward like a navel.
meanings.sent5: The building had an umbonic roof that sloped down in a circular shape.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the center or focal point.
meanings.sent1: The umbonic spot on the map marked the exact center of the city.
meanings.sent2: Her speech had an umbonic message that resonated with everyone in the audience.
meanings.sent3: The party's umbonic activity was a game that brought everyone together in the middle of the room.
meanings.sent4: The painting's umbonic color drew all attention to the central figure.
meanings.sent5: The umbonic idea in the story was the key to solving the mystery.
